ogdl.support

Class Characters

  • java.lang.Object
    • ogdl.support.Characters

  • public final class Characters
extends Object
    OGDL text character classes. It classifies integers into End, Break, Special and Text. Characters are represented by integers, so that -1 and any Unicode code point can be classified. $Id$ Initial date: Jul 2008

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      Characters()

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean isBreak(int c)
      break ::= LF | CR
      static boolean isBreakOrEnd(int c)
      Return true for any character below 0x20 (space) which is not 0x09.
      static boolean isEnd(int c)
      Return true for any character below 0x20 (space) which is not 0x09 (tab) or 0x10 (newline) or 0x13 (return).
      static boolean isOperator(int c) 
      static boolean isPathSpecial(int c) 
      static boolean isSpace(int c)
      space :: = TAB | SP
      static boolean isSpecial(int c) 
      static boolean isString(int c)
      String (unquoted string) Any printable character not including: '(', ')', quotes or or ','
      static boolean isText(int c) 
      static boolean isWord(int c)
      Word = number, letter, _, or any char > 127
